page.title: 02MINING,PARK MILL COLLIERY 1.
page.content: THERE IS EVIDENCE OF 700 YEARS OF MINING IN EMLEY. EARLY RECORDS FROM THE{13TH CENTURY}SHOW THAT MONKS FROM {BYLAND ABBEY}MINED AND SMELTED IRON ORE. THEIR CENTRE IN EMLEY WAS{BENTLEY {GRANGE}(266134). THEY MINED USING {BELL PITS }METHOD. A PIT WAS SUNK TO A DEPTH OF 7 METRES AND WORKED OUTWARDS FROM THE BOTTOM. WHEN THE ROOF BEGAN TO COLLAPSE, FLOODING OR AIR BECAME BAD A NEW PIT WAS SUNK AND THE OLD ONE FILLED IN. {BELL PITS}DATING FROM{16th CENTURY}CAN BE SEEN ON EITHER SIDE OF WOODHOUSE LANE (265131) THESE ARE AMONGST THE FINEST EXAMPLES IN THE WORLD AND HAVE A CONSERVATION ORDER PROTECTING THEM. {MINING AT PARK MILL COLLIERY} AN ANCIENT LAW ALLOWED ONLY THE LORD OF THE MANOR TO HAVE A WATERMILL TO GRIND CORN. THEY WERE CALLED SOKE MILLS.
